text: Former presidents, ambassadors and high-profile activists are slated to speak during the second night of the Democratic National Convention. Follow updates and analysis.
Biden Faces A Convention Test, To Offer A Vision Beyond Beating Trump
All About That Base: Trump And Biden Voters In 2020
Former first lady Michelle Obama stole the show, as Democrats tried out a glossy, highly produced, made-for-TV special to replace the energy of a live crowd at a convention.
Michelle Obama Rips Trump As 'Clearly In Over His Head'
Bernie Sanders Lays Out An Existential Choice For Progressives
Louis DeJoy, an ally of President Trump, has come under fire in recent weeks for what's viewed as directives to slow down USPS in order to suppress absentee or mail-in votes.
Another Post Office Election Challenge: Making Sure Ballots Are Postmarked
Manafort passed internal campaign information to a Russian intelligence officer during the last election, a bipartisan Senate report on Russian 2016 election interference shows.
New research suggests that penguins' ancestors originated not in frozen Antarctica but, instead, off the coasts of Australia and New Zealand, adapting to new climes over 22 million years.
It's a sign that minority, lower income, and first-time home buyers are getting hit hard financially amid the pandemic. But a vast majority are protected by Congress from foreclosure.
After plummeting 34% from its prior peak, the stock index has staged a steady recovery — gaining more than 50% since March, when lockdowns shut down much of the economy.
A lot of theories exist for why the decades after World War II were so great for the American middle class. But there is a missing element: access to the economy for non-white males.
UNC-Chapel Hill had to cancel in-person classes after a surge in coronavirus cases. Mimi Chapman tells NPR that "should give every other large public university in the country pause."
President Trump claimed New Zealand is seeing a "big surge" in coronavirus cases, on the same day New Zealand reported nine new cases, and the U.S. added nearly 42,000.
How Bars Are Fueling COVID-19 Outbreaks
The council's Republican Caucus is calling for Democratic Mayor Greg Fischer to step down. The caucus cites Fischer's handling of probes into the Breonna Taylor and David McAtee deaths as reasons.
Toni Van Pelt cites health concerns in stepping down from leading the National Organization for Women. An internal investigation found evidence of "governance issues" but not racial discrimination.
A new documentary shows how the CIA and Britain's MI6 engineered the forcible removal of Iranian Prime Minister Mohammad Mosaddegh. The 1953 coup continues to rattle history to this day.
How The CIA Overthrew Iran's Democracy In 4 Days

Tuesday night's focus at the Democratic National Convention is about what makes a leader, presenting arguments against President Trump. Follow live updates and analysis.
7 Takeaways From The 1st Night Of The Convention
Democrats have their national convention this week, and Republicans will host theirs next week. Each party's candidate is hoping to energize their voter base.

The Democratic National Convention ends its second night with the formal nomination of Joe Biden — a process that was made historic by the virtual nature of the roll call. These are the highlights from Tuesday.

Vocal ensembles that normally would be touring the summer festival circuit have organized a virtual concert series. Groups hail from 10 different countries including the U.S., Zimbabwe and France.

The Democratic National Convention ends its second night with the formal nomination of Joe Biden — a process that was made historic by the virtual nature of the roll call. These are the highlights from Tuesday.
7 Takeaways From The 1st Night Of The Convention
Democrats have their national convention this week, and Republicans will host theirs next week. Each party's candidate is hoping to energize their voter base.
Louis DeJoy, an ally of President Trump, has come under fire in recent weeks for what's viewed as directives to slow down USPS in order to suppress absentee or mail-in votes.
Another Post Office Election Challenge: Making Sure Ballots Are Postmarked
Manafort passed internal campaign information to a Russian intelligence officer during the last election, a bipartisan Senate report on Russian 2016 election interference shows.
New research suggests that penguins' ancestors originated not in frozen Antarctica but, instead, off the coasts of Australia and New Zealand, adapting to new climes over 22 million years.
State Attorney General Xavier Becerra will challenge new restrictions aimed at limiting Deferred Action for Childhod Arrivals applications while the Trump administration aims to end the program.
It's a sign that minority, lower income, and first-time home buyers are getting hit hard financially amid the pandemic. But a vast majority are protected by Congress from foreclosure.
After plummeting 34% from its prior peak, the stock index has staged a steady recovery — gaining more than 50% since March, when lockdowns shut down much of the economy.
A lot of theories exist for why the decades after World War II were so great for the American middle class. But there is a missing element: access to the economy for non-white males.
UNC-Chapel Hill had to cancel in-person classes after a surge in coronavirus cases. Mimi Chapman tells NPR that "should give every other large public university in the country pause."
Michigan State And Notre Dame Suspend In-Person Learning Over COVID-19 Concerns
President Trump claimed New Zealand is seeing a "big surge" in coronavirus cases, on the same day New Zealand reported nine new cases, and the U.S. added nearly 42,000.
How Bars Are Fueling COVID-19 Outbreaks
Soldiers reportedly detain President Ibrahim Boubacar Keita after surrounding his residence following months of protests in the West African nation.
A new documentary shows how the CIA and Britain's MI6 engineered the forcible removal of Iranian Prime Minister Mohammad Mosaddegh. The 1953 coup continues to rattle history to this day.
How The CIA Overthrew Iran's Democracy In 4 Days
The council's Republican Caucus is calling for Democratic Mayor Greg Fischer to step down. The caucus cites Fischer's handling of probes into the Breonna Taylor and David McAtee deaths as reasons.
Toni Van Pelt cites health concerns in stepping down from leading the National Organization for Women. An internal investigation found evidence of "governance issues" but not racial discrimination.
As they prepare to return to a campus under new leadership, some students have mixed feelings about what Jerry Falwell Jr. and President Trump have meant for both their college and evangelicalism.
